Body: Description: Need drive expanded on our EPP server again.  Drive already expanded on vmware server side.  We cleaned the logs 6 months ago so we likely just need to expand the drive.
Meeting scheduled with the customer to expand disk on EPP server at 3 PM CST on 12/12/2024
Next Steps Updated: Requested customer create a snapshot of the VM before attempting the drive expansion procedure. A meeting is scheduled for 12/12/2024 at 3 PM CST in order to address the issue.
What We've Learned Updated: Customer has reached out to have drive expanded on the EPP Server. Logs were cleaned 6 months ago.

What We've Learned Updated: - Sent Teams invite for 3 PM CST
- Requested Greg create a snapshot of the VM before attempting to expand the disk for the EPP server
- Joined meeting with Greg Donham, Eduard-Alexandru Nut, Botond-Robert Biro

- Logs cleaned in July 2024
- Message reporting "Your appliance is running low on disk space, there is 36.97 gb free from 281.89 gb (13%). Epp Server functionality and performance may be severly affected. Use Audit log Backup to reduce the logs stored in the database, 
delete older system and audit log backups, and tune polices to reduce incoming log count, for further assistance contact support."

- Customer wants to keep the logs for future reference
- Requested customer to save Audit log Backups by downloading them to be later saved else where

- Eduard performed the disk expansion on the EPP server
- VM was stopped to adjust the storage to 429.57 GB allocated
- VM rebooted
- Storage adjustment verified from back end
- Message still present and will be there until cronjob finishes within 30 to 35 minutes
- Auditlog backup setup not running 
- Recommended to customer to back up logs for a one month
- Customer wants to backup for 3 month periods
- Auditlog Backups configured for 3 month period as per customer request
Next Steps Updated: Leaving case open over weekend to see if message clears and customer does not report any issues

What We've Learned Updated: - Sent Teams invite for 3 PM CST
- Requested Greg create a snapshot of the VM before attempting to expand the disk for the EPP server
- Joined meeting with Greg Donham, Eduard-Alexandru Nut, Botond-Robert Biro

- Logs cleaned in July 2024
- Message reporting "Your appliance is running low on disk space, there is 36.97 gb free from 281.89 gb (13%). Epp Server functionality and performance may be severly affected. Use Audit log Backup to reduce the logs stored in the database, 
delete older system and audit log backups, and tune polices to reduce incoming log count, for further assistance contact support."

- Customer wants to keep the logs for future reference
- Requested customer to save Audit log Backups by downloading them to be later saved else where

- Eduard performed the disk expansion on the EPP server
- VM was stopped to adjust the storage to 429.57 GB allocated
- VM rebooted
- Storage adjustment verified from back end
- Message still present and will be there until cronjob finishes within 30 to 35 minutes
- Auditlog backup setup not running 
- Recommended to customer to back up logs for one month
- Customer wants to backup for 3 month periods
- Auditlog Backups configured for 3 month period as per customer request

What We've Learned Updated: - Customer still reporting an issue with your appliance is running low error
- Customer created a snap shot of the VM
- Backup auto back up logs
- Verified through Appliance how much space is allocated for Disk Space System: 66% from 50 G,  for Disk Space EPP Server: 98 G - 29% from 361 G 
- Backend access to attempt to clean out files
- Verified SMTP settings and if alerts are set up
- Flaviu recommends disabling alerts for Alerts - Content Aware Alerts - H Number Movement ( To prevent future alerts)
- Customer created screen shots of settings for the Content Aware Alert Test.
- Accessed EPP Server backend and removed System Alert logs
- System alerts cleared from EPP Server
- Customer will test the System Maintenance > External Storage settings to place the Audit log backups on an network external drive
- Space issue has resolved after deleting Alert Logs
Next Steps Updated: Customer has requested to close ticket
